comment: Inequality of arithmetic and geometric means. Here ` ( M gsum F ) ` calculates the group sum within the multiplicative monoid of the complex numbers (or in other words, it multiplies the elements ` F ( x ) , x e. A ` together), and ` ( CCfld gsum F ) ` calculates the group sum in the additive group (i.e. the sum of the elements). This is Metamath 100 proof #38. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
